abstract: British Parliament spends three hours bitterly belittling Donald J Trump, but does not recommend banning him from entering country; debate was triggered by successful online petition which asserted Republican presidential candidate ought to be denied entry for engaging in hate speech; some think outrage is exaggerated and ban would backfire.
lead_paragraph: Even as lawmakers condemned Mr. Trump during a three-hour debate in Parliament, they appeared to back away from the idea of barring him from entering the country.

headline.main: British Have a Go at Trump but Shy Away From a Ban
headline.print_headline: British Have a Go at Trump but Shy Away From a Ban

snippet: Even as lawmakers condemned Mr. Trump during a three-hour debate in Parliament, they appeared to back away from the idea of barring him from entering the country.
